quest_title: Find the domain of the function \( \cfrac {x^2+x+1}{x^2-8x+12}\)
explanation_txt:
\( f(x) = \cfrac {x^2+x+1}{x^2-8x+12}\)

Upon factorization,

\( f(x) = \cfrac {x^2+x+1}{(x-6)(x-2)}\)

Since denominator can't be zero, \(x\) can't be 6 or 2.

So, the domain is \(\mathbb{R} - \{2,6\}\)
question_plain_title: Find the domain of the function
explanation_plain_text:

quest_title: 1gm of a mixture of calcium carbonate and sodium chloride reacts completely with 100ml N/10 HCl. The % of \(\text{CaCO\({}_{3}\)}\) in the mixture is
explanation_txt:
No. of gram equivalent of HCl reacted = 0.1*0.1 = 0.01

Amount of CaCO\(_3\) present in the mixture = No. of gram equivalent \(\times\) Equivalent Weight = 0.01*50 = 0.5 gm

The percentage of CaCO\(_3\) = \(\cfrac{0.5}{1} \times 100 \%\) = 50%

quest_title: The value of \[ \int _{\, a}^{\, b}\cfrac{x}{|x|} dx,\, \, a<b<0 \] is
explanation_txt:
For \( a < b < 0 \), and \( a < x < b \),

\( |x| = -x \)

So, given integral becomes:

\[ \int_{a}^{b} (-1) dx = \left[ -x \right]_a^b = -b+a \]

Replacing \( -b = |b|, a = -|a| \),

\[ \int_a^b \cfrac{x}{|x|} dx = |b| - |a| \]

quest_title: A body of mass 2 kg is hung on a spring balance mounted vertically in a lift. If the lift descends with an acceleration equal to the acceleration due to gravity ‘g’, the reading on the spring balance will be
explanation_txt: We know that weight is mass \(\times\) acceleration. As the lift is descending with the acceleration of \('g'\), the apparent acceleration is 0, thereby a free-fall condition. In other words, during free-fall, a body experiences weightlessness.

quest_title: A fireman of mass 60 kg slides down a pole. He is pressing the pole with a force of 600 N. The coefficient of friction between the hands and the pole is 0.5, then acceleration of fireman is
explanation_txt:
\(m g-\mu R=m a\)
\(\therefore a=\cfrac{60 \times 10-0.5 \times 600}{60}=\cfrac{600-300}{60}\)

\(\qquad=\cfrac{300}{60}=5 \mathrm{m} / \mathrm{s}^{2}\)

quest_title: The work done in blowing a volume v of soap bubble is w then work done in blowing a volume 2v is
explanation_txt:
\(\mathrm{W}=\mathrm{T} \times 8 \pi \mathrm{r}^{2}=\mathrm{T} .8 \pi\left(\cfrac{3 V}{4 \pi}\right)^{2 / 3}\)

\(\therefore \mathrm{V}=\cfrac{4 \pi}{3} r^{3}\) \(\quad\) \(\Rightarrow r=\sqrt[3]{\cfrac{3 V}{4 \pi}}\)

\(\mathrm{w}^{\prime}=\mathrm{T} .8 \pi(\sqrt[3]{\cfrac{3 \times 2 V}{4 \pi}})^{2}=\mathrm{T} .8 \pi\left(\cfrac{6 V}{4 \pi}\right)^{2 / 3}\)

\(\therefore \cfrac{\mathrm{w}^{\prime}}{\mathrm{w}}=\left(\cfrac{6 \mathrm{V}}{8 \pi} \times \cfrac{4 \pi}{3 \mathrm{V}}\right)^{2 / 3}\)
\(\therefore \mathrm{w}^{\prime}=(2)^{2 / 3} \mathrm{w}\)
question_plain_title: The work done in blowing a volume v of soap bubble is w then work done in blowing a volume 2v is

quest_title: In a cyclic process, the internal energy of the gas
explanation_txt: Internal energy is a state function i.e. depends upon the values of parameters \(P,T\) and \(V\) at that state. The same state is obtained at the end of the cycle in cyclic process. So, the internal energy remains constant.
question_plain_title: In a cyclic process, the internal energy of the gas
explanation_plain_text: Internal energy is a state function i.e. depends upon the values of parameters and at that state. The same state is obtained at the end of the cycle in cyclic process. So, the internal energy remains constant.

quest_title: Two rods A and B are of equal lengths. Their ends are kept between the same temperature and their area of cross-sections are \(A _ { 1 }\) and \(A _ { 2 }\) and thermal conductivities \(K _ { 1 }\) and \(K _ { 2 }\). The rate of heat transmission in the two rods will be equal, if

\(\left( \cfrac { Q } { t } \right) _ { 1 } = \cfrac { K _ { 1 } A _ { 1 } \left( \theta _ { 1 } - \theta _ { 2 } \right) } { l } \text { and } \left( \cfrac { Q } { t } \right) _ { 2 } = \cfrac { K _ { 2 } A _ { 2 } \left( \theta _ { 1 } - \theta _ { 2 } \right) } { l }\)

Given \(\ell_{1}=\ell_{2}\) and \(\Delta \theta_{1}=\Delta \theta_{2}\)

Also \(\left( \cfrac { Q } { t } \right) _ { 1 } = \left( \cfrac { Q } { t } \right) _ { 2 } \Rightarrow K _ { 1 } A _ { 1 } = K _ { 2 } A _ { 2 }\)

quest_title: A radioactive material decays by simultaneous emission of two particles with respective half lives 1620 & 810 yrs. The time is yrs after which one fourth of the material is decay
explanation_txt:
\(\mathrm{T}=\cfrac{\mathrm{T}_{1} \mathrm{T}_{2}}{\mathrm{T}_{1}+\mathrm{T}_{2}}=\cfrac{1620 \times 810}{620+810}=540 \mathrm{yrs}\)
\(\cfrac{\mathrm{N}}{\mathrm{N}_{\mathrm{o}}}=\left(\cfrac{1}{2}\right)^{\cfrac{t}{T_{1 / 2}}}\)
or, \(\cfrac{3}{4}=\left(\cfrac{1}{2}\right)^{\cfrac{t}{T_{12}}}\)
or, \(\ln \left(\cfrac{3}{4}\right)=\cfrac{\mathrm{t}}{\mathrm{T}_{1 / 2}} \ln 0.5\)
or, \(\mathrm{t}=\mathrm{T}_{1/2} \cfrac{\ln \left(\cfrac{3}{4}\right)}{\ln 0.5}=\cfrac{\mathrm{T}}{1.44} \cfrac{\ln \left(\cfrac{3}{4}\right)}{\ln (0.5)}=150 \mathrm{yrs}\)

quest_title: A spherical mirror forms an erect image three times the linear size of the object. If the distance between the object and the image is 80 cm, the focal length of the mirror is
explanation_txt:
\(\quad\)m = ?3

v = 80 ? u

Now,m = v/u

\(\quad\)or, 3 = \( \cfrac{80 - u}{u} \)

\(\quad\)or, 3u = 80 ? u

\(\quad\)or, u = 20cm

\(\quad\)\(\therefore \)v = ?60cm

\(\quad\)f = \( \cfrac{uv}{u + v} = \cfrac{20\left(-60\right)}{20 - 60} = \cfrac{-1200}{-40} \) = 30cm

quest_title: A 50V, 50Hz ac supply is connected to a resistor of resistance 40\(\Omega\) in series with a solenoid whose inductance is 0.2H. The Pd between ends of resistor is found to be 20V. The resistance of wire of solenoid is
explanation_txt:
\(\mathrm{I}=\cfrac{\mathrm{V}_{\mathrm{R}}}{\mathrm{R}}=\cfrac{20}{40}=0.5 \mathrm{A}\)
\(\mathrm{Z}=\cfrac{\mathrm{V}}{\mathrm{I}}=\cfrac{50}{0.5}=100 \Omega\)
Here, \(\mathrm{Z}=\sqrt{(\mathrm{R}+\mathrm{r})^{2}+\mathrm{X}_{\mathrm{L}}^{2}}\)
or, \((\mathrm{R}+\mathrm{r})^{2}=\mathrm{Z}^{2}-\mathrm{X}_{\mathrm{L}}^{2}\)
or, \(40+\mathrm{r}=\sqrt{100^{2}-(2 \pi \mathrm{fL})^{2}}\)
or, \(\mathrm{r}=77.7-40=37.7 \Omega\)

quest_title: In the reaction \(\text{NH\(_{3}\)}\) (g)   \(\leftrightharpoons\) \(\cfrac{1}{2} \(\text{N\)\(_{2}\)}\) (g) + \(\cfrac{3}{2} \(\text{H\)\(_{2}\)}\) (g) \(\text{,\(\alpha\)}\) is the degree of dissociation of \(\text{NH\(_{3}\).}\) Then the numbers of moles at equilibrium per initial mole of \(\text{NH\(_{3}\)}\) will be
explanation_txt:
Given reaction is:

\(NH_3 \rightleftharpoons \cfrac{1}{2}N_2 + \cfrac{3}{2}H_2\)

Let initial concentrations be \(1,0,0\) for ammonia, nitrogen amd hydrogen respectively.

When the concentration of \(NH_3\) drops to \(\alpha\), ammonia equivalent to concentration of \(1-\alpha\) will be dissociated.

The concentration of \(N_2\) and \(H_2\) will be \(\cfrac{1}{2} (1-\alpha)\) and \(\cfrac{3}{2}(1-\alpha)\) respectively.

So, total number of moles is

\(\alpha + \cfrac{1}{2}(1-\alpha) + \cfrac{3}{2}(1-\alpha) = 2-\alpha\)

quest_title: The locus of a variable point whose distances from two fixed points is constant is:
explanation_txt:
Assume an axis through the fixed points be \(X\) axis and the midpoint of them be origin. The axis perpendicular to \(X\) axis through origin is \(Y\) axis.

Let the fixed points be \( (a,0) \) and \( (-a,0) \). And the variable point be \( (x,y) \).

As given;

\( \sqrt{ (x-a)^2+y^2 } + \sqrt{ (x+a)^2 + y^2 } = c \)

which on simplification gives the equation of ellipse.

quest_title: When a rod of metal B is dipped in \(\text{A\(^{2+}\)}\) at \(25^{ 0}\)C (given the standard electrode potentials are \(\text{A\(^{2 +}\)/A}\) =  - 0.76 v and \(\text{B\(^{ 2 + }\)/B}\) = + 0.34v)
explanation_txt:
\(E_{A^{++}/A} < E_{B^{++}/B}\)

So, \(A\) will be oxidized and \(B\) will be reduced.

The reaction will:

\(A + B^{++} \rightarrow A^{++} + B\)

quest_title: A sample of \(\text{Na\({}_{2}\)CO\({}_{3}\).}\) \(\text{H\({}_{2}\)O}\) weight 0.62gm is added to 100ml of 0.1N \(\text{-H\({}_{2}\)SO\({}_{4}\)}\) solution. The resulting solution is
explanation_txt:
Equivalent Weight of Na\(_2\)CO\(_3\).H\(_2\)O = 62

No. of gram equivalent of Na\(_2\)CO\(_3\).H\(_2\)O = \(\cfrac{0.62}{62}\) = 0.01 gram equivalents

No. of gram equivalents of H\(_2\)SO\(_4\) = 0.1*0.1 = 0.01 gram equivalents

Both sodium carbonate and sulphuric acid have equal number of gram equivalents. Hence, the resulting solution is neutral.
question_plain_title: A sample of weight 0.62gm is added to 100ml of 0.1N solution. The resulting solution is
explanation_plain_text:
Equivalent Weight of NaCO.HO = 62

No. of gram equivalent of NaCO.HO = = 0.01 gram equivalents

No. of gram equivalents of HSO = 0.1*0.1 = 0.01 gram equivalents

Both sodium carbonate and sulphuric acid have equal number of gram equivalents. Hence, the resulting solution is neutral.

quest_title: \( \lim _ { x \rightarrow a } \cfrac { \sqrt { 3 x - a } - \sqrt { x + a } } { x - a } = \)
explanation_txt:
\[ \begin{align} & \lim _ { x \rightarrow a } \cfrac { \sqrt { 3 x - a } - \sqrt { x + a } } { x - a } \\ & = \lim _ { x \rightarrow a } \cfrac { \sqrt { 3 x - a } - \sqrt { x + a } } { ( x - a ) } \times \cfrac { \sqrt { 3 x - a } + \sqrt { x + a } } { \sqrt { 3 x - a } + \sqrt { x + a } } \\ &= \cfrac { 2 } { 2 \sqrt { 2 a } } = \cfrac { 1 } { \sqrt { 2 a } } \end{align} \]

OR:

Using L-Hopital's rule,

\[ \begin{align} & \lim _ { x \rightarrow a } \cfrac { \sqrt { 3 x - a } - \sqrt { x + a } } { x - a } = \lim _ { x \rightarrow a } \cfrac { 3 } { 2 \sqrt { 3 x - a } } - \cfrac { 1 } { 2 \sqrt { x + a } } \\ & = \cfrac { 3 } { 2 \sqrt { 2 a } } - \cfrac { 1 } { 2 \sqrt { 2 a } } = \cfrac { 1 } { \sqrt { 2 a } } \end{align} \]
explanation_plain_text:
OR:

Using L-Hopital's rule,

quest_title: A man is 45 m behind the bus when the bus start accelerating from rest with acceleration 2.5 m/s2. With what minimum velocity should the man start running to catch the bus?
explanation_txt:
Let man will catch the bus after \(t\) sec. So, he will cover distance \(ut\).

Similarly, distance travelled by the bus will be \(\cfrac { 1 } { 2 } a t ^ { 2 }\).

For the given condition,

\(u t = 45 + \cfrac { 1 } { 2 } a t ^ { 2 } = 45 + 1.25 t ^ { 2 } \quad \left[ \text{As } a = 2.5 m / s ^ { 2 } \right]\)

\(\Rightarrow u = \cfrac { 45 } { t } + 1.25 t\)

To find the minimum value of u,

\(\begin{array} { l } { \cfrac { d u } { d t } = 0 \text { so, we get } t = 6 \text { sec then } } \\ { u = \cfrac { 45 } { 6 } + 1.25 \times 6 = 7.5 + 7.5 = 15 \mathrm { m } / \mathrm { s } } \end{array}\)

quest_title: A block of mass \(\text{M}\) is placed on the horizontal rough surface of a lift. The coefficient of friction between surface of block and lift is \(\text{\(\mu\) }\). A force \(\text{F}\) is applied on the block and lift accelerate upward with '\(\text{a}\)', then limiting force of friction is
explanation_txt:
When lift accelerates upward

R – mg = ma

R = mg + ma

\(\therefore\) Frictional force (Ff) = \(\mu R=\mu m(g+a)\)

quest_title: A particle is thrown from top of a building of height 50 m with a velocity of 30 m/s at an angle of 30\(^{\circ}\) above the horizontal. The distance from the base of building to the point where particle hit the ground is
explanation_txt:
\(h=-u \sin \theta t+\cfrac{1}{2} g t^{2} \)
\(\text { or, } 50=-30 \times \sin 30 t+\cfrac{1}{2} \times 10 t^{2} \)
\(\text { or, } 5 t^{2}-15 t-50=0 \)

\(\text { or, } t^{2}-3 t-10=0 \)
\(\text { or, } t^{2}-5 t+2 t-10=0 \)
\(\text { or, } t=5 \mathrm{sec}, t=-2 \mathrm{sec} \)
\(\therefore t=5 \mathrm{sec} \)

\(R=u \cos \theta \times t=30 \times \cos 30 \times 5 \)
\(R=u \cos \theta \times t=130 \mathrm{m} \)
